ul.li: Santa Clara Valley, California, United States

div.p: We are looking for a Blackbox QA Engineer to join our iTunes Store QA Team. Our team is responsible for running all ecommerce for the iTunes Store and is an integral part of an exciting and dynamic development organization. You will be responsible for testing and qualification of the iTunes Music Store and related services with a focus on testing e-commerce related features including consumer client interfaces and commerce data reconciliation. In addition,you will be interacting with internal and external teams and at times will be assigned infrastructure related projects for scalability solutions. With customers in over 155 countries, we are a fast-growing marketplace for music, movies, TV shows, books - and, of course, apps. Come join us!

ul.li: 5+ years of QA experience, with a consistent track record detecting and writing bug reports
Experience working with OS X and iOS, Android or Windows platforms
Proficiency in Java, Javascript, Unix, SQL, CSS, HTML, XML
You're flexible and able to adapt to rapidly changing requirements
You have a proven ability to partner and communicate multi-functionally, and to seek out information when required
You're comfortable with command-line interfaces, some exposure to shell scripts and UNIX.
Strong analytical skills and ability to autonomously solve problems, as well as collaborate with your team

div.p: You are a strong individual contributor that can work on projects independently and will also be required to collaborate with other team members. You are dynamic and prepared to test/ regress a high volume of changes on a day-to-day basis. You are detail oriented and are able to both perform and reconcile test data.
BS in Computer Science or similar experience
